intro: Fagonia latistipulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved fagonia, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with broad, flat leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Fagonia latistipulata is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with low precipitation.
